channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024010386
item.description:
Report X-2024010386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED TO INSPECT A PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO HAVE DRY ICE SUBLIMATION COMING FROM THE PACKAGE AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION APPROXIMATELY 2 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING ROMA BACON TOPPINGS WAS DISCOVERED. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM LOUISIANA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 81FY30, REINHART SHREVEPORT DIVISION, 524 W 61ST ST., SHREVEPORT LA 71106-2513.

item.title: Report X-2024010226
item.description:
Report X-2024010226

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was brought to QA by a tugger driver due to it leaking, DescribePack: Drum head was dented causing seal to be loosened and allowing product to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was kept in an upright position and put into a lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2024010230
item.description:
Report E-2024010230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A cap was left off the tanker after previous unload. When refilled, a small amount of material, <5gallons, was released from opening and immediately caught. Material was promptly cleaned up. Cap was reinstalled.

item.title: Report X-2024010221
item.description:
Report X-2024010221

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager found package on IC belt, package was brought to QA area. No product leaked out of package only on outer packaging. DescribePack: Once package was inspected it was found that a cap came loose causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in a lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2024010150
item.description:
Report E-2024010150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 1-gallon release of UN1830 "Liquid Fire Drain Line Opener" that was released from (2) 1-gallon poly jugs impacting the dock floor. The jugs were punctured by a forklift. No Drains, Soils or waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024010138
item.description:
Report E-2024010138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a three gallon spill of regulated UN1263 "Gun Wash" was released at Terminal XLU. (1) five-gallon plastic pail was punctured by a forklift during dock operations impacting Dock #22. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 30-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent used, the damaged pails, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010354
item.description:
Report X-2024010354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was sent up the conveyor belt to the sorters upstairs, causing it to loosen the caps and for it to leak. A facer saw the hazmat diamond and the leak and pulled the hazmat off the belt and brought it downstairs for it to be processed. DescribePack: Cap came loose due to being sent upstairs and put throught sortation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and package was put into a lined tote.
